properties.areaDesc: Christian, MO; Webster, MO; Douglas, MO; Wright, MO
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 18 at 8:03AM CST until January 18 at 8:30PM CST by NWS Springfield MO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Springfield has extended the

* Flood Warning for...
Webster County in southwestern Missouri...
Douglas County in southwestern Missouri...
Wright County in southwestern Missouri...
Eastern Christian County in southwestern Missouri...

* Until 830 PM CST Saturday.

* At 801 AM CST, the Department of Transportation reported flooding.
Up to one and a half inches of rain fell over the past 24 hours
causing flooding of several streams. While no additional rainfall
is expected, residual flooding will continue through today.

* Creeks, streams, and low water crossings will be especially
susceptible to the dangers of flooding.
Locations in the warning include...
Marshfield...                     Mountain Grove...
Rogersville...                    Ava...
Seymour...                        Mansfield...
Fordland...                       Dawson...
Norwood...                        Hartville...
Niangua...                        Duncan...
Diggins...                        Elkland...
Oldfield...                       Manes...
Brushyknob...                     Elkhead...
Grovespring...                    Rome...

This warning includes but is not limited to the following low water
crossings...
Route U at Bryant Creek northeast of Ava...
Route FF at Hunter Creek east of Ava...
Route EE at North Fork River south of Cabool...
Greenwood Road at The Pomme de Terre Headwaters...
and Route Y at Cowskin Creek 3 miles west of Ava.
properties.instruction:
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are
potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded
roads. Find an alternate route.
